reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent all around.
reviews.reviewText: I rarely post reviews but I think this shop has a repeat customer in me. Hopefully helpful in it's length :)Summary:This is a great box for a great price. Granted, I've only had this box about a week, I see some folks have reported issues after a few weeks (to which I'll update this post if things start going wonky).1) Wear:I expected the keys and mouse pad would be a lot more worn. Perhaps they'd been replaced though. There is some wear on the spacebar, one of the alt keys, one of the shift keys, and the letter N...but the mouse-pad is nearly flawless. Perhaps also these Elitebooks have been prominently use as work issued laptops they we're docked more often and used external mouse/keyboards. I also don't think it was pulled off the dock often though, there are hardly any scratches on the bottom. One tiny tiny scratch on the lid. I hadn't even noticed until I decided to write this review! No blown pixels, speakers are fine for laptop speakers. Probably won't be blown away.2) Speed:No lag or signs of problems with the processor, RAM slots, or graphics card at all. like none, really.I needed something low cost, in a short time period, and able to compile some older/heavfty/lengthy java(6) code with multiple libraries (non-nerd speak - do a lot of work). I read a ton of reviews on hardware (processor, ram, hard drive speed, graphic card memory usage, etc) and that's what I used to even find the specs I required - regardless of the actual brand/model etc. This box meets all my requirements, includes some extra stuff, and at a really really good price!3) Power units:Solid. Charges fully in expected time frame, holds charge for as long as I expect and as long as window battery reports. Power cord in good condition. Velcro rap still in tact and not all frayed!4) Value:I found what I thought would get my by for a few months while I saved up some more money for a i7 or better. Given the specs if this hardware setup, this really is the best deal ever for a refurb. I did increase the ram to 8GBs. The ability to go up to 16GB at this price point is a *HUGE* benefit in my opinion. The one thing I'll say about that is that the laptop I received has 2 2GB sticks so you can't just add 1 4GB stick to bring the box up to 8GB. Not a big deal if you're going to stay at 4GB. Adding 2 4GB sticks of RAM cost me an extra $46. I think I saw other reviewing mention that also. I don't see it in the specs. I did see a 8GB option that this seller carries but I wan'ted *new* sticks of RAM anyway - much better for the hardware overall (matching sticks).Couple things about the laptop, not so much the seller.I've been a dell user for +12 years - servers, desktops & workstations, laptops (heck, I still have my Jukebox!) but I know HP is relative solid so I wasn't too worried in switching. My 2nd repeat customer note is that whenever I *do* buy a new laptop it'll likely be an Elitebook or some flavor that will be available. It's *so* much more functional then the Dell Inspiron I was previously using.I'm still getting use to this pointing stick thing though. If you've never used one you might consider disabling it. I found myself brushing into it when typing fast and not realizing I've moved the mouse/cursor so that I'm typing in a totally different place - really annoying. I've disabled it for now. Clearly not the sellers fault, just a note about the laptop itself).Another note about this particular laptop - even though it weighs in nearly 5lbs I finds it really thin (for a form factor ~3ish years old) and doesn't *feel* like 5lbs. My commute is public transit for about an hour. I was carrying around a 5.2lber though - might just be the downsize from a 17".Lastly, I had some trouble with the additional function keys (ie, screen brightness, audio, etc). Turns out this is really common when a box is wiped. It was super easy finding them and installing myself. I'll tote - not the sellers fault really. Every other addon works - even this fancy finger print reader :)Overall - really great experience, great refurb, I'd do it again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars A nice little laptop
reviews.reviewText: A nice little laptop, but it is not what I wanted. I wanted a windows 7 laptop with windows 7 as the operating system. Can you send me a Windows 7 disk so I can install that operating system? If not, how do I return it?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's a really good deal for the money
reviews.reviewText: It's a really good deal for the money. It's very responsive and runs quickly. The fan spins up load and starts generating alot of heat if many functions are loaded. This computer works well for low spec gaming and any other minor services you may need for a laptop. I play games like Mass Effect 2, Rimworld, TF2, Shogun 2, and Brawlhalla on here no problem.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great. BTW
reviews.reviewText: The laptop arrived the very next day after ordering. A little rough in appearance. No matter as I didn't buy it for its looks. This unit was over $1500 new, I paid $200. A new copy of Win-7 is over $100. I ordered this one as it has Windows 7. The laptop is rugged and has an added feature, biometric security. You just run you finger over the fingerprint reader and it fills in the stored password. I use this to interface the computers in all of my Lincolns. Works great. BTW, the one I received is a little bit better than the original product description. The one I received is a HP 8470P.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2015
reviews.reviewText: the charging cord stopped working the day after I bought the computer

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ALL YOU NEED and MORE!
reviews.reviewText: No disappointments here! This laptop was above and beyond what I had anticipated...really just wanted space for songs...the price was right...it's fast, sleek, has many extra features, and is sure to provide good use for years to come! ( well, until they phase out Windows 7)..then I'll switch to Win 10...no problem. I recommend this laptop...I like the 3 usb ports, ( one of them is a usb 3.0). Hope this helps someone...I usually do about 4-5 various comparisons before I get something. This is a good laptop!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Dead Pixel - different version of windows than advertised - decent for the price other than that
reviews.reviewText: Seems to work ok (though havent tested battery yet) - but came with a dead pixel in the screen and what was advertised as Windows 7 Pro is actually Windows 10 Home - I would rather have Win 7 Pro for I could then upgrade to Win 10 Pro without an upgrade. I can return it for the deal pixel but will likely be out another $50-$75 since it took awhile for seller to respond and all the other laptops from other sellers that I was look at are gone at this price point.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not real happy with the vendor
reviews.reviewText: Laptop came with a dent in the outside top cover and two dents inside where the latches for the cover engage the lower half near the keyboard. Bottom cover latches near the docking port on the underside were unlatched and only one would engage and lock. When plugged in battery started charging, but Windows said no functioning battery was found so I suspect battery was defective. Biggest problem was Windows 7 wasn't activated and there was no activation code included. Windows also said the copy of Windows installed wasn't genuine. I ran a code retrieval program that got the activation code from the registry and when I tried to activate Windows it said the activation code was a generic one and couldn't be used. Got a return label from Amazon and will send it back tomorrow, reordered another from vendor Blazing Prices and hope to get a functional computer with the second attempt. Not real happy with the vendor, leaving in a couple of days on a business trip and need this computer for work-related tasks. With the delay I'll be hard pressed to get all my software installed and functioning before I leave. Kudos to Amazon customer support tho for quick response tho,
